uc3m.bomberman.main

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • uc3m.bomberman.main.Main

  • public class Main
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class of the game. It follows a structured programming paradigm to perform all the actions the game needs to be executed
    Since:
    December 12th, 2017
    See Also:
    {@link Game}, {@link GameBoardGUI}, {@link Entity}

    • Method Detail

      • nextId

        public static final int nextId()
        This method generates a new ID for a new entity. This is the method that should be used when assigning id's to new entities
        Returns:
        The id of the next entity to add

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Main method; this method creates a Game object (with default player name "Bomberman") and a GameBoardGUI object, which will be later used throughout the execution of the game; it will execute ticks and renders in a periodic fashion: 30 ticks, 60 frames (renders) per second; first ticks, then renders. The runtime of this program can be divided into two processes: ticks and renders When the program makes the calculations it needs to run the game (i.e., move entities, check collisions, etc.), we say it has done a tick; when it prints the result of those calculations on the board (GameBoardGUI), it has done a render. It will keep doing so as long as the game is running (the game can be stopped by the player's death, the user starting a new game or the player winning the game)
        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        {@link #render(Game, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link #tick(Game, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link #newGame(String, GameBoardGUI, int)}

      • newGame

        public static Game newGame(java.lang.String name,
                           GameBoardGUI board,
                           int nLevels)
        This method will create a new Game and loads its entities into the board.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the player of the new game
        board - GameBoardGUI object to show the game on
        nLevels - Number of levels the game will have
        Returns:
        The created Game object
        See Also:
        {@link Game}, {@link #loadEntities(Game, GameBoardGUI)}

      • tick

        public static java.lang.String tick(Game game,
                                    GameBoardGUI board)
        This method performs the ticks of the game, i.e., it will perform all the calculations the game needs when running. It will, in the following order: 1)Send the tick to all the "tickable" entities (entities that act when a tick is done, i.e.: bomb, etc.) 2)Read the user's input 3)Check the collisions of every entity with each other 4)Check whether the registered entities in the game are alive or not, and kill them appropriately 5)Check whether the player has advanced to the next level or nor

        Parameters:
        game - Game to be used
        board - GameBoardGUI to be used
        Returns:
        eventHandler(Game, GameBoardGUI)
        See Also:
        {@link #tickHandler(Game, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link #eventHandler(Game, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link #collisionHandler(Game, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link #checkAliveEntities(Game, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link #checkIfNextLevel(Game, GameBoardGUI)}

      • tickHandler

        public static void tickHandler(Game game,
                               GameBoardGUI board)
        This method sends a tick to all the entities and tiles in game that need it. The entities that need a tick are enemies and bombs. Bombs will perform a tick and enemies will move. If a bomb has exploded, it will create its explosion and remove it from game and board. The tiles are ticked through the method referenced below.
        Parameters:
        game -
        board -
        See Also:
        {@link #removeEntity(Game, GameBoardGUI, Entity)}, {@link Bomb#tick()}, {@link Enemy#moveEnemy(Game)}, {@link Game#getEntities()}, {@link Map#tickTiles()} - method that ticks tiles

      • eventHandler

        public static java.lang.String eventHandler(Game game,
                                            GameBoardGUI board)
        This method reads the last action sent to and acts accordingly; it also gives game that last action to store it. If any of the movement arrows have been pressed, it moves the player. If the space has been pressed, it places a bomb where the player is in case the player has enough bombs. If tab has been pressed and the player has the proper upgrade, it will explode all bombs. Else, if a new game has been ordered, it will return its name. Else, if the action is a command, it will parse it.
        Parameters:
        game -
        board -
        Returns:
        If a new game has been ordered creating, it returns the name of the new game. Else, it returns "" empty String
        See Also:
        {@link #commandParser(Game, GameBoardGUI, String)}, {@link #detonateAllBombs(Game, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link Player}, {@link Entity#collides(Map)}, {@link GameBoardGUI#gb_getLastAction()}

      • collisionHandler

        public static void collisionHandler(Game game,
                                    GameBoardGUI board)
        This method checks the collisions of every entity with every other and collides them invoking the proper method; it also checks the collisions (i.e.: standing on special tiles) of those entities with the map When two entities are in the same cell, they collide. If one of those entities is movable, the method MovableEntity.onCollision(Entity) is called. Then, this method checks if any entity is standing on an explosion, in which case it will be damaged. It then checks if the player is standing on an upgrade, and it it is, then the upgrade is consumed.
        Parameters:
        game -
        board -
        See Also:
        {@link Game#getEntities()}, {@link Entity#collides(Entity)}, {@link MovableEntity#onCollision(Entity)}, {@link Player#onCollision(Entity)}

      • checkAliveEntities

        public static void checkAliveEntities(Game game,
                                      GameBoardGUI board)
        Checks if all registered entities are alive, and removes those that are not from both game and board
        Parameters:
        game -
        board -
        See Also:
        {@link #removeEntity(Game, GameBoardGUI, Entity)}, {@link #gameOver(Game, GameBoardGUI)} - is called if the player has died

      • checkIfNextLevel

        public static void checkIfNextLevel(Game game,
                                    GameBoardGUI board)
        This method will check whether the player has openned the door or not, and if it has, load a new map, and its entities. If the next level could not be loaded, it will mean we have arrived at the end, and so the game will end with the winning screen.
        Parameters:
        game -
        board -
        See Also:
        {@link #win(Game, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link Player#getOpenedDoorOnTouch()}, {@link #loadEntities(Game, GameBoardGUI)}

        Loads the menu and sets board visible
        Parameters:

        board -

      • render

        public static void render(Game game,
                          GameBoardGUI board)
        This method will print all the graphic information of the game on the board. It first will print the map and its tiles; then it will place the entities in their correct positions (note that the sprites have to be loaded before rendering). Then the stats will be updated
        Parameters:
        game -
        board -
        See Also:
        {@link #renderMap(Map, GameBoardGUI)}, {@link #renderEntities(Entity[], GameBoardGUI)}, {@link #renderStats(Game, GameBoardGUI)}

        board - Board where to put the entity's sprite
